meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a child.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's playful and kiddish behavior made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: Her kiddish laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent3: The kiddish drawing of a sun had a big smiley face.
meanings.sent4: His kiddish excitement for the ice cream truck was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The kiddish voice on the phone was unmistakably that of a young girl.

meanings.definition: Playful or childlike in a way that is endearing.
meanings.sent1: The kitten's kiddish antics entertained us all evening.
meanings.sent2: She had a kiddish charm that made everyone adore her.
meanings.sent3: His kiddish attempt at juggling the oranges was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The kiddish innocence in her eyes melted his heart.
meanings.sent5: The kiddish giggle of the toddler was music to their ears.

meanings.definition: To behave in a silly or immature manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to kiddish around when he's with his friends.
meanings.sent2: Stop kiddishing and focus on your homework, young man.
meanings.sent3: The siblings kiddished around, pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent4: She kiddished by making funny faces in the mirror.
meanings.sent5: The group kiddished their way through the team-building exercise.
